channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @Namer98 @DBashIdeas Many fond Shabbos memories of playing with my kid. What parents need to know is that underneath the infinite complexity it‚Äôs actually simple, and if you‚Äôre not playing competitively it‚Äôs both fun and easy.

item.description: @AD_Lobel Two entered Orthodox and came out gay. Two entered from Conservative families and came out as transdenominational Jewish communal professionals. Two got semicha. The other two were engaged to the same woman (and one married her).
item.source:markdown: @AD_Lobel Two entered Orthodox and came out gay. Two entered from Conservative families and came out as transdenominational Jewish communal professionals. Two got semicha. The other two were engaged to the same woman (and one married her).

item.description:
@MisfitTorah Tanakh strongly platforms the critics of the establishment. Its only constructive utopian suggestions relate to architecture.

@MisfitTorah Implicitly, it opposes systems of government that throw critics out windows.

@MisfitTorah While the closest I came to reading Milton was hearing R Aharon z‚Äùl give a shiur once, I suspect the first strong defense of press freedom makes explicit reference to Tanakh. So there‚Äôs that.

@MisfitTorah The fact that Shmuel thinks the monarchy is a bad idea but implements it any way speaks to a lack of concern about the fine points of the constitution.
@liamsadams @reporterdeepa I know it‚Äôs not your doing, but it‚Äôs really annoying that my subscription to my local Gannett paper doesn‚Äôt get me through your paywall.
item.source:markdown: @liamsadams @reporterdeepa I know it‚Äôs not your doing, but it‚Äôs really annoying that my subscription to my local Gannett paper doesn‚Äôt get me through your paywall.

item.description:
@AD_Lobel Four entered the Yeshiva College Poetry Society in 1984/85‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

@AD_Lobel Just to be clear: the first two categories don‚Äôt map onto the second two categories. One of the gay poets got semicha; the other was engaged to a woman. It was the 80s.

item.description:
@mordkhetzvi Gotta agree with you. Though as a book cover designer, I see what they‚Äôre trying to do, am convinced I could do better, realize it‚Äôs not a simple assignment‚Ä¶

@mordkhetzvi and then get revolted to have that assignment in my head. So I definitely feel for the cover designer.
